p: It has been predicted that, due to higher atmospheric concentrations of CO 2 and other greenhouse gas emissions, temperatures will increase and precipitation patterns will change [ 44]. Agriculture is arguably one of the sectors that are most sensitive and vulnerable to climate change. Wheat is considered the most significant cereal for human nutrition and is widely cultivated in many regions, such as Asia, Europe, and Northern Africa. Therefore, numerous studies have examined the impacts of climate change on wheat growth and yield in the major wheat-producing regions of the world [ 3, 4, 7, 27, 45â€“ 49].
